meaning: To cut off a part of; shorten by cutting; lop.
To shorten (a number) by dropping one or more digits after the decimal point.
To replace (the edge of a crystal) with a plane face.
(mathematics) To shorten a decimal number by removing trailing (leading) digits; to chop.
Appearing to terminate abruptly, as a leaf of a tulip tree or a coiled gastropod shell that lacks a spire.
Having a square, flattened, or broad end.
Lacking a normal apex, as some snail shells.
sentences: Exact Word Match Only The default search is set to automatically truncate search words.
The truncate output, tho, clearly indicates an untwinned crystal.
One unique feature is that you can write a bunch of tweets and upload them in Twaitter's special file format and the service will schedule the posts and truncate them as needed.
To truncate a word in Business Source Elite add an asterisk at the end of the word.
The eyes are on the right side, and the teeth in the jaws compressed and truncate.
Whatever number is settled on for the PCC from 2005, you cannot truncate the terms of any existing members.
The stem at one extremity is truncate, but at the other is terminated by a vermiform fleshy appendage.
Short, truncate in front and behind; cloacal orifice transverse; gills present; rather thin cuticle; no radula.
